questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.
As an administrator for this subscription, you are educating new users on which component to use for audio and visual communications with colleagues.
Which of the following is the component that should be used?

discussion.content: 100% is C

Selected Answer: C
ms teams

Selected Answer: C
C. Microsoft Teams
It is obviously Skype (for personal use)
100% Microsoft Teams

Selected Answer: C
C. Microsoft Teams

Selected Answer: C
Answer C.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C.

comments.content:
Microsoft Exchange Online (Option A) is an email and calendaring service that allows users to access their emails, calendars, and contacts from any device. It does not provide audio and visual communication features.

Enterprise Mobility + Security (Option B) is a suite of security and management tools that helps protect and manage mobile devices, applications, and data. It does not provide audio and visual communication features.

Microsoft SharePoint Online (Option D) is a web-based platform for document management, collaboration, and content management. It does not provide audio and visual communication features.

discussion.content:
The component that should be used for audio and visual communications with colleagues in Microsoft Office 365 is Microsoft Teams (Option C).

Microsoft Teams is a unified communication and collaboration platform that offers audio and video conferencing, chat, file sharing, and other features. It is designed for teamwork and enables users to work together from anywhere, at any time.

Selected Answer: C
Key phrase “ audio and visual communications”

Selected Answer: C
Let the users use teams.

Selected Answer: C
correct answer
TEAMS 100%
Teams (equipos)

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Instructions: For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct


1. “You can also integrate that data into solutions that include Power Automate, Power BI, and data from Dynamics 365.”
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/canvas-apps/connections/connection-common-data-service
2. Microsoft Teams users can now access Dynamics 365 data without the need for licenses for the CRM platform.
https://www.computerworld.com/article/3625553/microsoft-teams-users-get-license-free-access-to-dynamics-365-data.html
3. Using Power Apps, you can quickly build custom business apps that connect to your data stored either in the underlying data platform (Microsoft Dataverse) or in various online and on-premises data sources (such as SharePoint, Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365, SQL Server, and so on).
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/powerapps-overview
Oks, estão corretas

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Yes -
The Microsoft Dataverse connector is used to connect to Dynamics 365 data

Box 2: Yes -
Microsoft Teams users get license-free access to Dynamics 365 data

Box 3: Yes -
The Microsoft Dataverse connector allows you to connect Power Platform to Dynamic 365 data
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/important-changes-coming#dynamics-365-connector-is-deprecated https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/commondataserviceforapps/ https://www.cigconsultants.com/post/microsoft-teams-users-get-license-free-access-to-dynamics-365-data

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Instructions: For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
No, it is SaaS
No it does not, D365 is seperate
Yes, you can integrate CRM with sharepoint etc

comments.content: SharePoint is definitely a M365 app.
Sharepoint isn’t a M365 app. Also, Dynamics 365 doesn’t need any of the M365 apps to work.

discussion.content: How about the fundamentals of this exam :( . (I think these questions are really not 'fundamental' but alas.)
For the third box, is it possible we are not understanding it correctly ? If we refer to the answer given, I wonder

comments.content:
maybe the key is 
that Dynamics 365 CRM does not depend on Microsoft 365 applications for its operation. However, it integrates with Microsoft 365 apps like Outlook, Excel, Teams, and SharePoint to provide enhanced functionality and a smoother experience for users. Therefore the answer to the third statement is NO.

discussion.content: No,No,Yes
so 3rd is yes.
https://www.sherweb.com/blog/dynamics-365/dynamics-365-office-365-work-together/

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: No -

Dynamics 365 is SaaS -

Box 2: No -
Dynamics 365 is not part of Microsoft 365

Box 3: No -
A connector can be used to connect to Dynamics 365 data but Dynamics 365 does not have Microsoft 365 apps.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/get-started/developers

questions.question_text:
A group of employees and users outside the company must be able to collaborate on a project in real time by using a whiteboard.
In the Microsoft 365 admin portal, which Office 365 product should you configure?

discussion.content: Correct!!!

Selected Answer: D
Microsoft Teams is correct answer

Well ok MS, you can almost answer therefore these questions with 'Teams' as you can almost load any app from within Teams. There is a standalone 'Microsoft Whiteboard' app. But ok, accessing it from Teams, a bit far fetched but ok . it's the best answer then but I think it's not the primary entry point for the Whiteboard app.
Microsoft equipes, oks.

Selected Answer: D
Microsoft Teams is correct answer
Teams is the correct answer

Which tool should you choose?
